description: 共同科英文（二）課程為一學期兩學分課程，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此目標，本課程要求教師盡量用英語上課，努力營造一個豐富的英語環境，讓學生不但有充分機會以英語參與課堂活動，且樂於使用英語與同學及老師溝通。
goals: 1. 增進學生英語溝通表達能力 2. 透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神 3. 透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野 4. 透過課堂討論培養批判精神 5. 提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣
syllabus:
**English I - Upper Intermediate - Spring 2022**

**Time:** Monday, 10:20-12:10                    **Classroom:** 公館 S202

**Objectives****:** This course is designed to support college freshmen in their use of **English language in an academic context** through **intensive and extensive reading** and **skill/strategy training**. In addition, it also aims to build student proficiency in the output language skills—**writing and speaking**—through a variety of activities that integrate all four language skills. Therefore, the main objectives of this semester will be to develop students’ **(1)** **fluency in critically expressing ideas** in oral and written forms in English, **(2)** **English presentation skills**, **(3) the TOIEC test** and **(4) autonomous learning skills**. In order to do so, there is a **five-pronged approach** to the course:

**1) Firstly,** the **course textbook** and **online practice website** consist of a purposefully structured skills and strategies program to **propel language learning** and **create independent learners**. Furthermore, the textbook helps improve **vocabulary learning, reading proficiency** and **develop practical critical thinking.** There will also be four **Chapter Reviews** to quiz student comprehension.

**2)** Secondly, over the course of the first-half of the semester, students will undertake one major **task-based presentation project using Powerpoint,** in which task groups, of no more than 3 students per group, are asked to **investigate areas and topics** that are **of serious interest to themselves**, and then **present their work** to the class.

**3) Thirdly,** students are expected to prepare for and do the **TOEIC LR test** at least. It is **a free test**. The **TOEIC SW** test will also be free for those who score over 785 on the LR test. There will be **no Lexile Test** this semester.

**3) Fourthly,** students will need to do at least **_12 hours_ of** **autonomous learning (around one hour a week)** in total this semester. **TOEIC preparation can be included.** These experiences must be **proven, catalogued and/or recorded** and handed in at the end of the semester**.**

**4) Finally**, there will be a **writing workshop** in which students will be asked to write **a short critical essay** based on class work.

**N.B: All course elements will be evaluated and assessed for final grading**
